relation: P-1 P-5 MMR1, MMR2 and ABC Lab

I really enjoyed the time I spent on the Super Sara. I started a wrestling team onboard that was made of of enlisted men, officers, sailors, and marines. The Med Cruise of 1987 was a time I'll never forget!
sara was my first ship and i will never forget the time i soent on her.
had a great time. will never forget the ship or all the guys i had the privleg to work for and with. i was in the cht shop and pipe shop. hope the ship becomes a museam.
I worked in AIMD/IM3 Shop 4 in the FLIR Shop

From the Yards at NNSY to the RED SEA what a trip, Never will forget my shipmates who were lost. What a great Ship. I will miss you "Super SARA" So sad to end up at a scrap yard. if your remember me send me a email.
I would just like to say that I had a lot of great friends and wonderful tour in Europe.
My 1st ship. It was showing its age.
I pushed the button for the 300,000th launch on catapult # 1. alot of good memories and friends were made on that hunk of steel.

I was in V-1 and got sick of the BS from them so I transferd to V-4 and spent the rest of my Navy days as a drunk! Had a great time in all the ports, that's what I was told! If anyone remembers me, please visit my site, www.MrFloridaHomes.com
Worked on the import fire party and supply rooms.
I made my first of four Med deployments on her in my naval career. I worked with some great guys LB, KG, Bell x 2, Hadnot TX, Hill, Acommo LT Threat and Commo LCDR Bass and host of others.
Enjoyed my time on the Saratoga, great friends, great crew, great cruise to the Med...Palma, Benidorm, Athens...anyone remember Bobby's Best American Bar in Athens?
Crash and Salvage 1987-1991. 1987 Med cruise thru Desert Storm.
Great time on the Sara. Great friends in OI Div.
Came onboard as a deck seaman left as a GMG. Worked in the Inport Fire Party, Brig and MAA.
Remember all fun times in Palma. Did our admiral really have a girl friend there?
Looking to connect with some old shipmates!!
Attached to Captians Gig and search and rescue also number 3 diesel operator
This was the best time I have had in my 21 years of service.
Had a lot of great experiences on this ship and some not so great. Still think of Hiafa and the 21 shipmates that did not make it. Hope to here form some old friends email me.
A/C&R shop Production control division, Trouble call shop
Had a blast while I was there ship was in dry dock being over hauled spent lots of time in mayport an virgina beach.

Was damage control most of my time on the Super Sara! Fire Party inport. I have to say as many others have, some of the best and some of the worst times in my life. I look back at it now and think I wish I could go back!
looking for the flight deck control gang.
Just seeing who's out there and saying hey! Anyone here from BT1 Alford?????
good times with all of the supply guys bowen,harrison

Best of time; worst of times type thing. I'd like to hear from the ex-shippy's I knew. Sad to see the Sara being scrapped. I painted exterior and redid all the non-skid in NNSY. Bittersweet. todd_beaver@hotmail.com
Hello,I sure do miss all the guy's from MMII room. Enjoyed all the good time that we shared, hope to see some of the gang, at the next reunion.
Came aboard right after she came back of her 87 cruise and whet through the whole yard period in Portsmouth, Va and back to Mayport. I remember all the fun we had working with the crazies in v-4.
